de.esoco.lib.logging

Class LogLevelFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.lib.expression.function.AbstractFunction<T,java.lang.Boolean>
        • de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.AbstractPredicate<LogRecord>
          • de.esoco.lib.logging.LogLevelFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.function.Function<LogRecord,java.lang.Boolean>, java.util.function.Predicate<LogRecord>, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class LogLevelFilter
extends de.esoco.lib.expression.predicate.AbstractPredicate<LogRecord>
    A predicate implementation that filters log levels. New instances are created through the static factory methods.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate

    • Method Detail

      • isLevel

        public static LogLevelFilter isLevel(java.util.Collection<LogLevel> rLevels)
        Returns a log level filter instance for a certain collection of log levels. Independent from the argument the LogLevel.FATAL log level will always be part of the resulting filter.
        Parameters:
        rLevels - A collection containing the log levels to return a filter for
        Returns:
        The log level filter for the given log levels

      • isLevel

        public static LogLevelFilter isLevel(LogLevel... rLevels)
        Returns a log level filter instance for a certain set of log levels. Independent from the argument the LogLevel.FATAL log level will always be part of the resulting filter.
        Parameters:
        rLevels - The log levels to return a filter for
        Returns:
        The log level filter for the given log levels

      • startingAt

        public static LogLevelFilter startingAt(LogLevel rLevel)
        Returns a log level filter instance with a certain minimum log level. Only messages with that level or greater will be logged. The order of log levels from lower to higher severity is TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL. The ending log level is always the level FATAL.
        Parameters:
        rLevel - The starting (minimum) log level to return a filter for
        Returns:
        The log level filter for the resulting log level range

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.Boolean evaluate(LogRecord rRecord)
        Returns TRUE if this filter contains the log level stored in the given log record.
        See Also:
        Function.evaluate(Object)

      • getMinimumLevel

        public LogLevel getMinimumLevel()
        Returns the minimum log level this filter is configured for.
        Returns:
        The minimum level

      • isLevelEnabled

        public final boolean isLevelEnabled(LogLevel rLevel)
        Checks if the argument log level is enabled for logging.
        Parameters:
        rLevel - The log level to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if the level is enabled for logging
